result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Albert Brock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Victor Albert Brock is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Victor Albert Brock was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Albert Brock

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:12 PM Defendant Victor Albert Brock in court, in custody.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Victor Albert Brock.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement to strike repeater on Count 1. Counts 2, 3 and 4 are to be dismissed. 22TR786 and 22TR787 are dismissed. For Count 1, 3 years prison fashioned as 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 24 months probation. Conditions of probation include serve 112 days jail with credit for 112 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs. Defendant eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Attorney Anderson stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court orders for Count 1 with repeater stricken, 3 years prison fashioned as 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 24 months probation. Conditions of probation include serve 112 days jail with credit for 112 days-time served, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs. If revoked, defendant eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.
Order on Motion to admit statements
Order on State's Motion to Admit Statements of Defendant
State's Motion to Admit Statements of Defendant

1:01 PM Defendant Victor Albert Brock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Victor Albert Brock.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson filed a motion. Defendant has been unable to come up with cash bail ordered at preliminary hearing. Requests a further reduction in cash bail. Defendant has local ties and finds he could post $200-300 cash bail. Defendant states he cannot post cash and would like a signature bond or try if cash bond is lowered. Court reviews St. Louis County cases. Attorney Anderson states he cannot access pending St Louis Co cases. State is opposed to lower cash bail and did agree to lower it at the preliminary hearing. State notes defendant is on supervision in St. Louis Co and an active warrant out of MN. Defendant has a significant number of fta's. Attorney Anderson finds duplication of cases out of St. Louis Co in regards to the warrants. Court denies bail modification. Attorney Anderson has received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Requests a speedy trial demand and asks for matter to be set for trial. Court accepts not guilty plea. Court sets pretrial and jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

10:14 AM Defendant Victor Albert Brock in court, in custody.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Victor Albert Brock.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions. 
Trailing citations-not guilty pleas entered, requesting they trail with criminal cases.
Court accepts pleas, will trail.
Attorney Anderson requests to address bail; there's been discussion to amend to $1000cb.  ADA LaLor has no objection to cash bail being amended.
Court amends cash bail to $1000, same conditions No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

03:00 PM Defendant Victor Albert Brock in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Craker received complain6t, not guilty pleas to cts 2 and 3, Requests prelim on ct 1
State requests $2500 cash bail, No drugs or para., No driving w/o valid license. Has 3 pending felonies and 2 misd. in St Louis cty. 10 FTA's since 2020, lists criminal history, all in MN. On Probation in MN
Att Craker- Belives 10 FTA's were same dates in several files, non violent felony, lives in area.
Court- Reviews statements of attorneys, has concerns, orders $2500 cash bail, No drugs or para., No driving w/o valid license.
Defendant- Will apply for public defendaer
Court sets date  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
